publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3733 Aileen Campbell: Clydesdale Riding for the Disabled Association—That the Parliament congratulates the Clydesdale branch of the Riding for the Disabled Association (RDA) on its recent successful move to new premises in Stanmore Stables, Lanark; recognises the important therapeutic benefits of horse riding for disabled people in addition to the recreational aspects of the activity; notes the recruitment drive that Clydesdale RDA has launched to attract new volunteers, which will allow the organisation to expand the number of riders it can support, and wishes the organisation every success in the future. Supported by: Robin Harper*, Christine Grahame*, David Stewart*, Kenneth Gibson*, John Lamont*, Jamie McGrigor*, Christina McKelvie*, John Scott*, Bob Doris*, Karen Gillon*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3733 Clydesdale Riding for the Disabled Association (lodged on 18 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Elaine Smith*, Sandra White*
